abstract: As media industry power players prepare for the annual post-July 4 tradition known as summer camp for moguls, the founders of some high-profile start-ups may also brushing up on their conversation skills to prepare for Allen & Company’s media retreat.
snippet: As media industry power players prepare for the annual post-July 4 tradition known as summer camp for moguls, the founders of some high-profile start-ups may also brushing up on their conversation skills to prepare for Allen & Company’s media retr...
lead_paragraph: As media industry power players prepare for the annual post-July 4 tradition known as summer camp for moguls, the founders of some high-profile start-ups may also brushing up on their conversation skills to prepare for Allen & Company‘s media retreat, according to The Holywood Reporter.

headline.main: Hopeful Start-Ups Head for Sun Valley

abstract: Google searches for the phrase “double dip” have been rising.
snippet: Google searches for the phrase “double dip” have been rising.
lead_paragraph: Most of the economists I’ve spoken with recently have said the likelihood of a “double dip” recession — that is, after a few quarters of growth, the economy starts shrinking again — is low. The general public still seems worried, though.

headline.main: Are Americans Worried About a Double Dip?

abstract: Antitrust regulators will most likely take a hard look at Google’s acquisition of the travel software company ITA, and then approve it, with conditions.
snippet: Antitrust regulators will most likely take a hard look at Google’s acquisition of the travel software company ITA, and then approve it, with conditions.
lead_paragraph: Last week, Google announced a deal to acquire ITA, a Boston-area  company that makes flight information software. The move will give Google a large foothold in the online travel search market, and control over a critical data source used by many of its competitors, including Kayak.com, Orbitz.com and Microsoft’s Bing.

headline.main: Regulators Prepare to Dig Into Google-ITA Deal

abstract: Andy Grove on job creation, Android and HTC and another of those odd Google Maps sightings.
